meanings.definition: A person who has an irrational fear or hatred of animals.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a zoophobe and gets scared even of small animals like birds.
meanings.sent2: The zoophobe refused to visit the zoo with us because of their fear of animals.
meanings.sent3: The zoophobe's reaction to seeing a puppy was quite comical, jumping on a chair in fear.
meanings.sent4: Her zoophobe tendencies made her feel like she was surrounded by monsters in the pet store.
meanings.sent5: The zoophobe's heart raced as they imagined being chased by a pack of wild animals.

meanings.definition: To have a strong aversion to animals.
meanings.sent1: I zoophobe the idea of going camping because of all the insects and animals.
meanings.sent2: She zoophobes cats and always crosses the street to avoid them.
meanings.sent3: He zoophobed the thought of having to touch the slimy frog during the science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the farm made her zoophobe and she hurried back to the car.
meanings.sent5: The child zoophobed the idea of going to the petting zoo and clung to their parent's leg.
